author: Staff Reporter
text:
Sixteen persons, including a CPI(M) leader, have been arrested for Tuesday’s mob attack on the Ilambazar police station in Birbhum district of West Bengal.

The attack followed a social media post by a youth that had allegedly hurt the sentiments of a minority community.

Birbhum Superintendent of Police Mukesh Kumar could not be reached for comments.

On Wednesday, a district court remanded them in judicial custody for 14 days.

The CPI(M) has accused the Trinamool government of “political vendetta.”
title: CPI(M) leader held for attack on police
